meanings.definition: Not capable of being imagined or grasped mentally.
meanings.sent1: The idea of a purple elephant wearing sunglasses is inconceivable.
meanings.sent2: It is inconceivable that pigs can fly without wings.
meanings.sent3: It would be inconceivable to see a talking fish in the ocean.
meanings.sent4: The concept of time travel is as inconceivable as a square circle.
meanings.sent5: The thought of a snowstorm in the desert is truly inconceivable.

meanings.sent1: The magician's trick was so inconceivable that the audience gasped.
meanings.sent2: The story of a cat playing chess is inconceivable to many.
meanings.sent3: It's inconceivable that a tree could suddenly start singing.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's performance was so flawless, it seemed inconceivable.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a rainbow-colored zebra is simply inconceivable.
